reviewText: I bought this DVD after seeing a clip online.  Kevin Hart and DeRay Davis stole the show!  I didn't feel that Aries Spears or Tommy Davidson used any new material.  Aries ALWAYS does the same impersonations. Cedric The Entertainer did a good job as host.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: This had me in tears. Cedric is fantastic, but the whole thing goes to Aries Spears. I think they are all great. Very funny.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Aries Spears and Kevin Hart were funny; really, just laugh out loud funny.  Tommy Davidson should seriously think about retirement or if not, he should learn how cater to the audience in front of him.  DeRay Davis.....for real?  Cedric, you need a new crew...
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: I enjoyed Shaq & Cedric The Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam so much. I watched it all and then put it right back on and laughed at these wonderful comic all over again. Cedric The Entertainer, DeRay Davis, Tommy Davidson, Aries Spears and Kevin Hart are so Hillariously funny. What a great entertaining DVD. Hey, you all must check out my new friend,TEXTBOOKGURU. I will buy more DVDs for sure from them. It came on time and in excellant condition. No problems at all. I will watch this DVD over and over. You can't feel sad when you are laughing your way through life. This is a must have DVD.Love,Almarine The Redeemed
summary: Shaq & Cedric The Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: This DVD is hilarious! I laughed a lot and hard when I initially watched this DVD and when I watched it the second and third time. To be honest I don't know how many times I've watched it but it was funny each and time. I'm one of those people that goes back and watches parts I really enjoyed and then try to tell their joke my way. The profanity was a bit much for my taste but I got beyond that and really enjoyed this DVD.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Very Good and Funny. Especially that Aries Spears character. I like it when the comedians got involved with the audience and crowd and famous musicians and other stars were there to enjoy a lot of laughs.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: I gave it a 3 because 3 of the 5 comics were funny.  Cedric is always funny, I didn't even know Tommy Davidson was so funny, and of course Kevin Hart was ridiculous!!!  The other two? No.  They BOTH called women in the audience "b*tch" and I find no humor in that at all.  Aries Spears called a woman in the audience a b*tch at the very beginning of his act! Deray finds being offensive funny.  His act wasn't funny at all.  Glad 3 of the 5 were funny, otherwise I'd be upset I bought this.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Funny as hell. I have watched it so many times and cant get enough. Definitely worth the price and I think its the best one out of all of them.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: I was introduced to this dvd courtesy of Youtube and a 2-minute clip of Arie Spears.  I immediately placed my order for a copy of this comedy show and can't say enough about it.  Cedric the Entertainer is brilliant .... Arie Spears is a star who needs to continue to rise because his combination of comedy/improv/impersonation is 100% on point .... and DeRay Davis is a force to be wreckoned with in the comedy world.  I was surprised that Tommy Davidson wasn't as funny as he has been in his previous standup concerts...but he warmed up the crowd.  Kevin Hart is hysterical.  This dvd is well worth every penny (and then some); it's something that for me will never get old!
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: for the most part I enjoyed Tommy Davis and Kelvin Heart as for the other two comics I found to be very dis-tasteful and down right disrespectful this is just my opinion comedy at is's best is not based on the use of foul language. and degrading females, and I am very aware that a number of females put themselves in a position to be disrespected as clearly shown in the dvd.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: I died laughing at this and so needed to laugh because I woke up irritated and upset. Just kept me laughing the whole time. This is worth your money. BUY IT!
summary: Had a better day after laughing at this!
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Not much I can really say, but I will say that Aries Spears was the only truly funny person on the DVD. I always thought he was pretty good on MadTV and I had no doubt he would deliver a good set. Additionally, I was also a bit surprised to hear what he referred to the women in the audience as....In terms of the other comedians it was pretty much the same formula. Which is pretty much: Ensure every other word that comes out of your mouth is a cuss word, jump around a lot, and lastly, make sure you tell nothing but grating and stupid "yall know that's right!!" -esque jokes.It's been awhile since I sat and watched this type of comedy and now I know why. The material is to limited and delivery of the jokes is simply just to overdone and similiar to evoke any laughter from the viewer for more than 15 minutes.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: LOL to my title, this was shot in Phoenix,AR when big shaq played for them and it was a awesome show. Funny as ever.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Oh my god this DVD is hilarious, I was in tears, I highly recommend watching this, all the great comediansGreat packaging will order again and shipping time was great as well thank you!!!!
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: After seeing this show on TV, I had to have the DVD.  I watch it again and again. Great show.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: One of the funniest comedy line up of all time. great price and it will have you rollin all day.
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: I'm hesitant to see about 95% of comedians live or even to buy the products because I don't want to hear one long session of constantly using the n-word and the b-word like it's a synonym for women, complaining about women, embarrassing audience members and talking about black people versus white people. I've seen it. I never laugh. It's not at all creative. There are comedians I absolutely love to see perform and then there's the other 95% that could stop doing jokes tomorrow and I'd volunteer to help them pack it up. But I did give this DVD a shot because I've liked performances from 4 of the 5. By the end of the DVD, it dropped to 3 of the 5.#1 Cedric the Entertainer: Love him! Everything about him! He's clean, he's sharp, he keeps his comedy clever and it's feel-good funny, even though I could do without the n-word.#2 Kevin Hart: He's fast topping my last of top five. After seeingSeriously Funny, I was so impressed by him. I like that he doesn't just rely on the usual suspects to be funny. He definitely could calm down on the b-word, but I'm somehow not offended when he uses it, mainly because he'll call himself one. Hard to be offended when you crack jokes about yourself.#3 Tommy Davidson: I can take him in small doses. He's cool, but he's always a little extra. Like, I like him but he doesn't know when to stop the joke. The Spanish TV and the Cops jokes were good, but I kept waiting for him to move on to the next one. Ced came back out and said he lost some brothas in the audience. Even if they spoke Spanish, that joke was too long, but he did mention that there were a lot of Latinos in the audience so that may have been a smart move. In that performance, he may have created a bunch of new fans.While I watched the last two, an interview with Bill Cosby from "Black Comedians: Why We Laugh" kept coming to mind.Deray Davis: I like the look of him. He's gorgeous, but almost everything that comes out of his mouth is complaining about women, degrading women or just clowning them dead in their face. Somebody in the audience says she loves him, he said he loves her but not if she's a six. The comment about the girlfriend who he got to stand up in the audience was completely uncalled for, and I was looking at her boyfriend EXTRA crazy for laughing along. He spends FAR too much time using the b-word, bragging about cheating and just complaining. If you hate women so much, my gawd, PLEASE start dating men. Save the rest of us the complaining OR take your own advice and let your talking "minutes" expire, even on nights and weekends. (I did like him inJumping the Broom, but he managed to be the bitter one in that film, too.) Okay, I will admit I laughed at the Chris Brown joke, not the domestic violence part but the part when he broke out dancing. Now THAT was funny. I think Deray Davis is funny as long as I tune him out when he starts talking about women. As soon as he goes in that direction, I'm immediately repulsed by him.Aries Spears: Didn't have a clue who he was, but the audience CLEARLY knew him. I didn't laugh once. I was irritated when he called several sistas the b-word in the audience but the one white woman he spoke to, I'm pretty sure he called her "woman" or "girl." That says a helluva lot about his character. I was excited to see Nelly and Ashanti walk in during his performance, but that was about the only highlight. The rest? More Deray Davis style complaining and a terrible impersonation of DMX. He was good with Jay-Z though. I'll give him that.This DVD truly confirmed my style of comedy. For the record, my top five are Bill Cosby, Chris Rock, Wanda Sykes, Bernie Mac and Steve Harvey tied with Cedric the Entertainer, but there are a few others (like Sinbad, when he decides to resurface). I just can't chuckle at somebody trying to win Most Bitter Brotha Award.
summary: If not for Ced and Kevin Hart, it'd been 1 star
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009

reviewText: Cedric = great host.DeRay = hilarious, gives funny relationship adviceKevin = hilarious, good jokes about his kidsAries = great impressionistTommy = seasoned stand-up comedian.i LOVED all of them! must-have for all comedy fans :)
Title: All Star Comedy Jam 2009
